alert.note: Alert for Conway; Faulkner; Garland; Montgomery; Perry; Polk; Pope; Pulaski; Saline; Scott; Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 10:44AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Heavy rain will impact portions of Perry, Faulkner, southern Conway, Garland, northwestern Saline, northeastern Polk, southeastern Scott, southern Yell, northern Pulaski, Montgomery and southeastern Pope Counties through 1215 PM CST... At 1040 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking an area of moderate to heavy rain with embedded thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wooster to near Little Missouri Falls Recreation Area. Isolated flooding will be possible and if a more imminent flash flood threat becomes apparent, a Flash Flood Warning may be needed. HAZARD...Moderate to heavy rain and isolated flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Ponding of water on roads, creeks out of their banks, nuisance flooding in urban areas. Locations impacted include... Little Rock... North Little Rock... Conway... Hot Springs... Sherwood... West Little Rock... Maumelle... Hot Springs Village... Morrilton... Perryville... Mount Ida... Little Rock AFB... Greenbrier... Vilonia... Mayflower... Ola... Wooster... Oppelo... Mountain Pine... Quitman... This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 100 and 148. Interstate 430 between mile markers 9 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
